New Records: Virat Kohli made a record 50th one-day international century
Key Match Events: WICKET!! Mitchell c Jadeja b Shami 134 (NZ 306-7)
WICKET! Phillips c Jadeja b Bumrah 41 (NZ 295-5)
WICKET! Williamson c S Yadav b Shami 69 (NZ 220-3)
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson hails ‘incredible’ Virat Kohli and ‘best in the world’ India
Rohit Sharma: ‘I’ve played a lot of cricket here, so I know any score on this ground – you cannot relax’
Miscellaneous Highlights: India have won five games chasing, the narrowest margin being four wickets, against New Zealand in the group stage
India have won five games batting first, the narrowest margin being 70 runs, against New Zealand today
The New Zealanders gave it a good go, but Shami shackled them with those two early wickets … and then returned to take five more
In all, we’ve seen 624 runs in the day. And when there are that many runs to be made, the match is won by the bowlers.
Others: Shami is now the leading wicket-taker in the tournament with 23, one more than Adam Zampa of Australia
This is the highest aggregate in a men’s World Cup knockout game, with 663 scored so far from 90 overs
